name: How to remove a user from sentry?.txt - User membership in Sentry
description: This section provides an example link to a forum discussion related to issues with changing user membership settings in Sentry. It suggests that users may encounter problems when trying to modify user roles or permissions within the Sentry application.
use_cases: Troubleshooting user membership issues in Sentry
Seeking help from the Sentry community forum
Understanding potential limitations or bugs related to user management in Sentry

name: How to remove a user from sentry?.txt - Examples
description: This section provides an example of how to remove a user from the Sentry application. It suggests that deleting the corresponding row from the 'auth_user' table in the database will effectively remove the user account. The section also includes a link to a forum discussion related to the issue of logging in with accounts that have the same email as a previously deleted account.
use_cases: Removing a user account from Sentry
Handling issues with duplicate email addresses after account deletion
Managing user accounts in Sentry

name: How to remove a user from sentry?.txt - Removing a user from the database
description: This section explains the process of removing a user from the Sentry database, which is a complex task due to the presence of foreign constraints and references to external tables. It involves accessing the database through SSH, identifying the user's ID, and performing the removal manually, as there is no straightforward way to perform a cascading removal.
use_cases: Removing a user from the Sentry database
Managing user accounts in Sentry
Handling complex database operations with foreign constraints

name: How to remove a user from sentry?.txt - Finding the user_id
description: This section appears to be incomplete or missing content. It introduces the topic of finding a user's ID in the Sentry application, which is likely a prerequisite step for removing a user. However, the section does not provide any actual instructions or explanations on how to find the user ID.
use_cases: Removing a user from Sentry
Managing user access in Sentry
Auditing or reviewing user accounts in Sentry

name: How to remove a user from sentry?.txt - Deleting user data from related tables
description: This section provides SQL commands to delete user data from various tables in the Sentry database. It appears to be a step-by-step guide for removing a user's information, such as audit logs, activity, project bookmarks, API tokens, IP addresses, email addresses, lost password hashes, group assignments, organization memberships, and finally the user account itself. This process ensures that all traces of the user are removed from the system.
use_cases: Deleting a user account from Sentry
Removing user data for compliance or privacy reasons
Cleaning up user data after an employee leaves the organization
Maintaining data integrity by removing stale or unnecessary user records
capabilities: Delete user data from audit log table
Delete user account from authentication table

name: How to remove a user from sentry?.txt - Taking a database backup
description: This section provides instructions for taking a backup of the Sentry database before removing a user. It explains that it's a good practice to create a backup, especially if you're cautious about making changes. The section includes two commands: one for creating a plain SQL dump of the database, and another for creating a formatted dump that can be restored using the pg_restore utility. The commands are specific to a PostgreSQL database hosted on Amazon RDS.
use_cases: Taking a database backup before making critical changes
Backing up a PostgreSQL database hosted on Amazon RDS
Creating a plain SQL dump of a database
Creating a formatted database dump for restoration
